parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE. The post contains "CMF 11240015" at the end, indicating it's likely electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. While not explicitly naming Brian Cristian, the post refers to "Un ales" (an elected official) and highlights his actions in Parliament, strongly implying Brian Cristian, given the context of the advertiser (USR Maramures) and the page name ("Brian Cristian").  The post uses "am făcut lumină acolo unde alții au tăcut" (I shed light where others were silent), which is a clear attempt to portray him in a positive light. This directly relates to his role as a candidate and aims to influence voters' perception of him.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The message is not a private communication but aims to reach a broad audience in Maramureș County.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. The primary objective is to positively influence voters' perception of Brian Cristian and encourage them to vote for him. Phrases like "Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" (Choose people who work for you) and "să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!" (let's have a Romania for everyone, not just for some!) are clear calls to action, aiming to sway voters in his favor. The post's content directly relates to his performance as a parliamentary candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It presents a biased and positive portrayal of Brian Cristian, focusing on his achievements while omitting any potential criticisms or counterarguments. It's clearly promotional rather than informative.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted promotional message designed to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections. The language used is not personal but rather political and persuasive.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>890958233105596</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by USR Maramures, promotes Brian Cristian, a parliamentary candidate.  The post uses language designed to positively influence voters' perception of him and encourages them to vote for him. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens the indication of electoral propaganda. While the post doesn't explicitly mention the parliamentary elections, the context (advertiser, page name, content) makes it clear that the intended effect is to influence the outcome of the elections.  The post's content is promotional, lacking the objectivity of journalistic reporting.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 890958233105596) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatul Brian Cristian, utilizând fraze precum "Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" și "să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!", cu scopul clar de a influența votul în favoarea acestuia. Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării.  Postarea, deși nu menționează explicit alegerile parlamentare, este evident legată de acestea prin contextul advertiserului, numele paginii și conținutul mesajului.  Aceasta nu respectă prevederile legale privind încheierea campaniei electorale și constituie propagandă electorală interzisă.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
